alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 04 at 3:44PM CDT until November 04 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Tarrant County in north central Texas... Northwestern Dallas County in north central Texas... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 344 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pantego, or near Arlington, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Dallas, Fort Worth, Arlington, Irving, Grand Prairie, Carrollton, Richardson, Mansfield, Euless, Bedford, Grapevine, Haltom City, Keller, Coppell, Hurst, Farmers Branch, Southlake, Watauga, University Park and Colleyville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35W between mile markers 56 and 57. Interstate 35E between mile markers 423 and 445. Interstate 20 between mile markers 440 and 457. Interstate 30 between mile markers 17 and 53. Interstate 45 between mile markers 282 and 284. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Texas. For your protection get inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
